intro: Cremastosperma osicola, commonly known as the narrowleaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and numerous stamens. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds with hooked bracts, aiding in seed dispersal by attaching to animal fur or clothing.
